qas.question: What helped spread Protestantism in France?

answers.text: availability of the Bible in vernacular languages
The availability of the Bible in vernacular languages

qas.question: When did the first French language bible appear?

context: <a0_2>The <a0_0>availability of <a0_1>the Bible in vernacular languages<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> was important to the spread of the Protestant movement and development of the Reformed church in <b6_0><b8_0>France<b8_0/><b6_0/>. The country had a long history of struggles with the papacy by the time the Protestant Reformation finally arrived. <a1_0><a1_2>Around <a1_1><b5_0><b7_0>1294<b7_0/><b5_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, a French version of the Scriptures was prepared by the Roman Catholic priest, <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Guyard de Moulin<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. A two-volume illustrated folio paraphrase version based on his manuscript, by Jean de Rély, was printed in <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>Paris<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> in <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b9_0>1487<b9_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>.
